content.description: Unclimbed offwidth, probably goes as a 5.7 layback.
content.location: On the left side of the south face

content.description: handjam up to a big ledge then continue to the top using short a flaring crack. probably goes at 5.7-5.9. Walk off climbers left.
content.location: This route is on the north facing side of the crag. walk climbers left from the road side around the point. this is the first crack you come to.

content.description: Climb the crack on easy jams with good stances for placing solid pro. This would probably make for a good first lead (5.6-5.8). walk off climbers left
content.location: Start in a left facing corner immediately left of unnamed ledge crack. This route is on the north facing side of the crag opposite of the road side.

content.description: Start on the right side of the route. Use the corner and flake to acquire the left crack. Hand jam your way to the top on a good looking crack. probably goes 5.7-5.9
content.location: Directly to the left of unnamed offwidth. This route is on the leftmost side of the southern face.

content.description: Start on an undercling and pull the bulge through small crimps. Top out by traversing left on thin but less steep ground, or traverse right and down climb an easy crack.
content.location: This route lies near the center of the south face. It is to the left and around the corner from Devil Anse.

content.description: This is a great line for the area. It was originally climbed with a bouldering pad but a fall from the top could be bad. Enjoy the opposing movement up a short flake. Top out and walk climbers right to the descent gully.
content.protection: Can be protected with a standard rack (Cams, nuts) some micro cams would be nice to protect the finger crack on the right side instead of plugging gear on the route. No anchors as of October 2018
content.location: Route is in a small right facing corner on the lower level of the southeastern side of the Alma west outcrop.
